text: Raphael Katz (November 21, 1841 - October 22, 1902) was an American businessman and politician. Born in Kurnik Province, Germany, Katz emigrated to the United States in 1856, living in New York, California, and Illinois, and then settled in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin in 1867. He married Caroline Helene Marks on July 20, 1874."Wisconsin, County Marriages, 1836-1911," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XR2N-L8B : 3 June 2016), Raphael Katz and Caroline Helene Marks, 20 Jul 1874; citing , City Of City Of Fond Du Lac, Wisconsin, United States, Wisconsin Historical Society, Madison; FHL microfilm 1,266,976. Katz was in the mercantile and clothing business. Katz served on the library board and on the school board. Katz served in the Wisconsin State Assembly and was a Democrat.Wisconsin Blue Book, 1901, Biographical Sketch of Raphael Katz, p. 748.Death of Raphael Katz, Grand Rapids Tribune (Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin), October 29, 1902. Katz died at his home in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin while still in office on October 22, 1902. Journal of Proceedings of the Forty-Sixth Session of the Wisconsin Legislature. 1903. Madison, WI: Democrat Printing Co., p. 214. His funeral was held on October 24, 1902 and he was buried at Rienzi Cemetery in Fond du Lac."Wisconsin, Death Records, 1867-1907," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XLWX-SY1 : 4 December 2014), R. Katz, 1902; citing Death, Fond du Lac, Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, Wisconsin State Historical Society, Madison; FHL microfilm 1,310,184. ==Notes== Category:1841 births Category:1902 deaths Category:German emigrants to the United States Category:Politicians from Fond du Lac, Wisconsin Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:School board members in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Raphael Katz
